Package main

Class GameEnvironment

java.lang.Object
main.GameEnvironment
public class GameEnvironment extends Object
This class controls all of the objects and information about the current game being played. Including the current user player, the game shop, arena and keeps track of the day and difficulty. It provides the functionality for the user to utilize the parts of the game and progress.
Version:
1.1, May 2022.
Author:
Lucas Redding

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameEnvironment()
    Constructor that initializes the day to 1 and creates the shop and arena for the game.

  • Method Details

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Gets the player associated with this game environment.
      Returns:
      user player of this game environment.

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer(String name, Monster startMonster)
      Sets the player associated with this game environment. creates the player and gives the player a name and starter monster based on parameters. Sets the gold of the player based on the difficulty of the game.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player to be created.
      startMonster - the starter monster to be added to the player's squad.

      public void increaseDay()

    • getMaxDays

      public int getMaxDays()
      Gets the maximum amount of days this game can run for.
      Returns:
      the maximum days of this game.

    • setMaxDays

      public void setMaxDays(int maxDays)

      Parameters:

    • getDifficulty

      public int getDifficulty()
      Gets the difficulty of this game. 1 is easy and 2 is hard.
      Returns:
      the integer difficulty of this game.

    • setDifficulty

      public void setDifficulty(int difficulty)
      Sets the difficulty of this game. 1 is easy and 2 is hard.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - the integer difficulty to set for this game.
